subject: Technology
title: Twitter: 140 Characters That Changed News
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Twitter: 140 Characters That Changed News.

hook.text: In 2006, a platform limited you to 140 characters. That constraint created an entirely new form of public conversation.

buildup.text: Twitter turned everyone into a broadcaster. Breaking news, opinions, and jokes reached millions in seconds.

discovery.text: Hashtags, invented by users, organized conversations around topics. Trending hashtags shaped global discourse.

twist.text: Twitter amplified both democratic movements and toxic harassment. The same tool empowered and endangered voices.

climax.text: Presidents, journalists, and activists made Twitter the de facto public square for real-time global debate.

punchline.text: A character limit forced brevity. Brevity made tweets spread like wildfire.
